spamosaic.preprocessingÔÉÅ

spamosaic.preprocessing.ADT_preprocess(adt_ads, batch_corr=False, favor='clr', lognorm=True, scale=False, n_comps=50, batch_key='src', key='dimred_bc')[source]ÔÉÅ

Preprocessing pipeline for ADT (protein) modality.

Parameters:

  • adt_ads (list of AnnData) ‚Äì ADT modality per batch.

  • batch_corr (bool) ‚Äì Whether to perform batch correction.

  • favor ({'clr', 'lognorm'}) ‚Äì Whether to use CLR or log-normalization.

  • lognorm (bool) ‚Äì Apply log-normalization (if favor=‚Äôlognorm‚Äô).

  • scale (bool) ‚Äì Whether to scale features.

  • n_comps (int) ‚Äì Number of components for PCA.

  • batch_key (str) ‚Äì Key for batch annotation.

  • key (str) ‚Äì Key to store reduced dimension result.

Return type:

None

spamosaic.preprocessing.Epigenome_preprocess(epi_ads, batch_corr=False, n_peak=100000, n_comps=50, batch_key='src', key='dimred_bc', return_hvf=False)[source]ÔÉÅ

Preprocessing pipeline for epigenomic modality (e.g. ATAC-seq).

Parameters:

  • epi_ads (list of AnnData) ‚Äì Epigenomic modality per batch.

  • batch_corr (bool) ‚Äì Whether to apply Harmony batch correction.

  • n_peak (int) ‚Äì Number of variable peaks to keep.

  • n_comps (int) ‚Äì Number of LSI components.

  • batch_key (str) ‚Äì Batch identifier key.

  • key (str) ‚Äì Output key in .obsm.

  • return_hvf (bool) ‚Äì Whether to return selected peak indices.

Returns:

If return_hvf is True, returns names and indices of selected peaks.

Return type:

Optional[Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]]

spamosaic.preprocessing.RNA_preprocess(rna_ads, batch_corr=False, favor='adapted', n_hvg=5000, lognorm=True, scale=False, n_comps=50, batch_key='src', key='dimred_bc', return_hvf=False)[source]ÔÉÅ

Preprocessing pipeline for RNA modality.

Parameters:

  • rna_ads (list of AnnData) ‚Äì RNA modality per batch.

  • batch_corr (bool) ‚Äì Whether to perform batch correction.

  • favor ({'adapted', 'scanpy'}) ‚Äì Which pipeline to use.

  • n_hvg (int) ‚Äì Number of highly variable genes.

  • lognorm (bool) ‚Äì Whether to apply log-normalization.

  • scale (bool) ‚Äì Whether to scale features.

  • n_comps (int) ‚Äì Number of output components.

  • batch_key (str) ‚Äì Key in .obs indicating batch identity.

  • key (str) ‚Äì Key to store result in .obsm.

  • return_hvf (bool) ‚Äì If True, return indices of selected HVGs.

Return type:

If return_hvf is True, returns tuple of (gene names, indices).

Perform centered log-ratio (CLR) normalization on count data.

Parameters:

adata (AnnData) ‚Äì Input data with count matrix in .X.

Returns:

adata ‚Äì Normalized AnnData object.

Return type:

AnnData

spamosaic.preprocessing.harmony(latent, batch_labels, use_gpu=True)[source]ÔÉÅ

Batch correction using Harmony.

Parameters:

  • latent (np.ndarray) ‚Äì Low-dimensional representation (e.g., PCA).

  • batch_labels (list or array) ‚Äì Corresponding batch annotations.

  • use_gpu (bool, default=True) ‚Äì Whether to use GPU acceleration.

Returns:

Batch-corrected latent representation.

Return type:

np.ndarray

class spamosaic.preprocessing.lsiTransformer(n_components: int = 20, drop_first=True, use_highly_variable=None, log=True, norm=True, z_score=True, tfidf=True, svd=True, use_counts=False, pcaAlgo='arpack')[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Latent Semantic Indexing (LSI) pipeline for dimensionality reduction.

Parameters:

  • n_components (int) ‚Äì Number of SVD components.

  • drop_first (bool) ‚Äì Whether to drop the first principal component.

  • use_highly_variable (bool or None) ‚Äì Whether to subset to highly variable features.

  • log (bool) ‚Äì Whether to apply log1p transformation.

  • norm (bool) ‚Äì Whether to normalize features.

  • z_score (bool) ‚Äì Whether to z-score features.

  • tfidf (bool) ‚Äì Whether to apply TF-IDF normalization.

  • svd (bool) ‚Äì Whether to apply SVD transformation.

  • use_counts (bool) ‚Äì Use .layers[‚Äòcounts‚Äô] instead of .X for data.

  • pcaAlgo (str) ‚Äì SVD backend.

fit(adata: AnnData)[source]ÔÉÅ

Fit the transformer on AnnData object.

fit_transform(adata)[source]ÔÉÅ

Fit and transform AnnData.

transform(adata)[source]ÔÉÅ

Transform AnnData using fitted transformer.

spamosaic.preprocessing.sparse_log1p_scale(X, scale=10000.0)[source]ÔÉÅ

Apply log1p transformation to sparse or dense matrix, scaled by a factor.

Parameters:

  • X (Union[scipy.sparse.spmatrix, np.ndarray]) ‚Äì Input expression matrix.

  • scale (float, default=1e4) ‚Äì Scaling factor applied before log1p.

Return type:

Transformed matrix (same type as input)
